text: The second issue — April 1907 The Ocean was a monthly pulp magazine which was started by Frank Munsey in March 1907. It published fact and fiction about sea-faring for eleven issues before being retitled The Live Wire so that it could cover a wider range of topics. The new title lasted for another eight issues before being folded in September 1908. ==References== Category:Magazines established in 1907 Category:Magazines disestablished in 1908 Category:Pulp magazines Category:Defunct magazines published in the United States Category:Monthly magazines published in the United States
title: The Ocean (magazine)
